oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original wills, Finn, Lawrence, 1881
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original will of Lawrence Finn, dated 15 March 1881. Illustrates the full document. Finn left “all [his] real estate, lying or being in the City of Nashville” to Daniel D. Phillips, his son-in-law, and his “present residence” to his daughter Mary E. Phillips. To his wife Elizabeth C., Finn bequeathed “all household & kitchen furniture, and all stock and farming utensils to do with as she pleases;” additionally, he left his wife “all railroad bonds & government bonds & Bank stock & whatever monies” he might have at his death. Finn’s will was witnessed by Neill S. Brown and Sam J. Keith. Finn’s will was presented for probate to the Davidson County Court on 3 June 1881. Forms part of Record Group 16, Original Wills, 1780-1925.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finn family; Phillips family
